br.uff.midiacom.ana.node
Class NCLMedia<T extends NCLElement,Ea extends NCLArea,Ep extends NCLProperty,El extends NCLLayoutDescriptor,En extends NCLNode,Ei extends NCLInterface,R extends ExternalReferenceType>

java.lang.Object
  br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.xml.XMLElementPrototype<T>

All Implemented Interfaces:

public class NCLMedia<T extends NCLElement,Ea extends NCLArea,Ep extends NCLProperty,El extends NCLLayoutDescriptor,En extends NCLNode,Ei extends NCLInterface,R extends ExternalReferenceType>
extends NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLNode<T,En,Ei>, PostReferenceElement

Class that represents a media node element. A media node represents a media object (text, audio, video, image, etc) inside an NCL document.
This element defines the attributes:

  • id - id of the media element. This attribute is required.
  • src - location of the media element content. This attribute is optional.
  • refer - reference to a media element. This attribute is optional.
  • instance - type of reuse the media element does. This attribute is optional.
  • type - type of a media element. This attribute is optional.
  • descriptor - descriptor that describes the media presentation. This attribute is optional.

This element has as children the elements:
  • area - element representing a anchor of the media. An anchor represents a subpart of the node content. The media can have none or several area elements.
  • property - element representing a property. The media can have none or several property elements.

setSrc

public void setSrc(SrcType src)
            throws XMLException
Sets the location of the media element content. This attribute is optional. Set the src to null to erase a src already defined.
The src value can be of the following type:
  • file:///file_path/#fragment_identifier - for local files.
  • http://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for the remote files got by the interactive channel using the http protocol.
  • https://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for the remote files got by the interactive channel using the https protocol.
  • rstp://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for streams got by the interactive channel using the rstp protocol.
  • rtp://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for streams got by the interactive channel using the rtp protocol.
  • ncl-mirror://media_element_identifier - for a content identical to the one being presented by another media element.
  • sbtvd-ts://program_number.component_tag - for a stream inside the received transport stream.

The local URI can be relative. The src can also define a time when the media represents a clock.

Parameters:
src - element representing the location of the media content or null to erase the location already defined.
Throws:
XMLException
See Also:
#setType(br.uff.midiacom.ana.datatype.enums.NCLMimeType)

getSrc

public SrcType getSrc()
Returns the location of the media element content or null if the attribute is not defined.
The src value can be of the following type:
  • file:///file_path/#fragment_identifier - for local files.
  • http://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for the remote files got by the interactive channel using the http protocol.
  • https://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for the remote files got by the interactive channel using the https protocol.
  • rstp://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for streams got by the interactive channel using the rstp protocol.
  • rtp://server_identifier/file_path/#fragment_identifier - for streams got by the interactive channel using the rtp protocol.
  • ncl-mirror://media_element_identifier - for a content identical to the one being presented by another media element.
  • sbtvd-ts://program_number.component_tag - for a stream inside the received transport stream.

The local URI can be relative. The src can also define a time when the media represents a clock.

Returns:
element representing the location of the media content or null if the attribute is not defined.
See Also:
#setType(br.uff.midiacom.ana.datatype.enums.NCLMimeType)

setType

public void setType(NCLMimeType type)
             throws XMLException
Sets the type of the media element. This attribute is optional. Set the type to null to erase a type already defined. The possible types are defined in the enumeration NCLMimeType.
The type application/x-ginga-settings is applied to a special media element, whose properties are global variables defined by the author or system variables that will be used in the document. An NCL document can have only one media element with that type.
The type application/x-ginga-time is applied to a special media element, whose content is a duration (UTC - Universal Time Coordinated). This type of media defines a clock. This media src is defined with the following syntax: year:month:day:hour:minute:second:fraction.

Parameters:
type - type of the media element from the enumeration NCLMimeType or null to erase a type already defined.
Throws:
XMLException

getType

public NCLMimeType getType()
Returns the type of the media element or null if the attribute is not defined. The possible types are defined in the enumeration NCLMimeType.
The type application/x-ginga-settings is applied to a special media element, whose properties are global variables defined by the author or system variables that will be used in the document. An NCL document can have only one media element with that type.
The type application/x-ginga-time is applied to a special media element, whose content is a duration (UTC - Universal Time Coordinated). This type of media defines a clock. This media src is defined with the following syntax: year:month:day:hour:minute:second:fraction.

Returns:
type of the media element from the enumeration NCLMimeType or null if the attribute is not defined.

setDescriptor

public void setDescriptor(java.lang.Object descriptor)
                   throws XMLException
Sets the descriptor that describes the media presentation. This attribute is optional. Set the descriptor to null to erase a descriptor already defined.
The descriptor referred can be defined in the document base of descriptors or in a base defined in an external document, imported by the base of descriptors or by the base of imported documents. When the descriptor is defined in an external document, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.

Parameters:
descriptor - element representing a descriptor, a reference to a descriptor element or null to erase a descriptor already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if any error occur while creating the reference to the descriptor.

getDescriptor

public java.lang.Object getDescriptor()
Returns the descriptor that describes the media presentation or null is the attribute is not defined.
The descriptor referred can be defined in the document base of descriptors or in a base defined in an external document, imported by the base of descriptors or by the base of imported documents. When the descriptor is defined in an external document, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.

Returns:
element representing a descriptor, a reference to a descriptor element or null if the attribute is not defined.

setRefer

public void setRefer(java.lang.Object refer)
              throws XMLException
Sets the reference to a media element. This attribute is optional. Set the reference to null to erase a reference already defined.
The referred element must be a media element that represents the same media defined in the body of the NCL document where this media is or in the body of an imported document. In the last case, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.
The referred element must directly define its attributes and child elements (area and property). It can not refer to another node.
When a media element defines the refer attribute, all attributes and child nodes defined by the referred node are inherited. The attributes defined by the media are ignored, except the id and instance attributes. The media can add new area and property elements to the referred media by defining then as children.
If an area or property defined in the media has the same id or name, respectively, of an area or property defined in the referred media, the area or property is ignored.
The referred element and the one that makes the reference must be considered the same, in relation to its data structure. That means that a node can be represented by more than one NCL element. Since nodes inside a composite node defines a set of nodes, a node can not be represented by more than one node inside a composition. That means that the id attribute of an NCL element representing a node is not only a unique identifier for the element, but also the only identifier corresponding to a node inside a composition.

Parameters:
refer - element representing a media, a reference to a media element or null to erase a reference already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if any error occur while creating the reference to the media element.
See Also:
#setInstance(br.uff.midiacom.ana.datatype.enums.NCLInstanceType)

getRefer

public java.lang.Object getRefer()
Returns the reference to a media element or null if the attribute is not defined.
The referred element must be a media element that represents the same media defined in the body of the NCL document where this media is or in the body of an imported document. In the last case, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.
The referred element must directly define its attributes and child elements (area and property). It can not refer to another node.
When a media element defines the refer attribute, all attributes and child nodes defined by the referred node are inherited. The attributes defined by the media are ignored, except the id and instance attributes. The media can add new area and property elements to the referred media by defining then as children.
If an area or property defined in the media has the same id or name, respectively, of an area or property defined in the referred media, the area or property is ignored.
The referred element and the one that makes the reference must be considered the same, in relation to its data structure. That means that a node can be represented by more than one NCL element. Since nodes inside a composite node defines a set of nodes, a node can not be represented by more than one node inside a composition. That means that the id attribute of an NCL element representing a node is not only a unique identifier for the element, but also the only identifier corresponding to a node inside a composition.

Returns:
element representing a media, a reference to a media element or null if the attribute is not defined.
See Also:
#setInstance(br.uff.midiacom.ana.datatype.enums.NCLInstanceType)

setInstance

public void setInstance(NCLInstanceType instance)
                 throws XMLException
Sets the type of reuse the media element does. This attribute is optional. Set its value to null to remove a value already defined. The possible types of reuse are defined in the enumeration NCLInstanceType.
If the type of reuse is instSame the media element and the referred media element are represented as one single instance. If a start a media is started all the other medias that represent the same instance are also started at the same time.
If the type of reuse is gradSame the media element and the referred media element are represented as one single instance. The medias presentation, however, starts as the media nodes are started by links defined in the document. That means that a media element that reuse another media element, when started, will begin its presentation at the same point the referred media presentation is.
If the type of reuse is new the media element represents a new instance of the media element and its presentation is not related to the media if refers.
The default value of the instance attribute is new.

Parameters:
instance - type of reuse from the enumeration NCLMimeType or null to erase a type already defined.
Throws:
XMLException

getInstance

public NCLInstanceType getInstance()
Returns the type of reuse the media element does or null if the attribute is not defined. The possible types of reuse are defined in the enumeration NCLInstanceType.
If the type of reuse is instSame the media element and the referred media element are represented as one single instance. If a start a media is started all the other medias that represent the same instance are also started at the same time.
If the type of reuse is gradSame the media element and the referred media element are represented as one single instance. The medias presentation, however, starts as the media nodes are started by links defined in the document. That means that a media element that reuse another media element, when started, will begin its presentation at the same point the referred media presentation is.
If the type of reuse is new the media element represents a new instance of the media element and its presentation is not related to the media if refers.
The default value of the instance attribute is new.

Returns:
type of reuse from the enumeration NCLMimeType or null if the attribute is not defined.

fixReference
